page.title: 04CANALS : USES
page.content: The Middlewich branch of the Trent and Mersey Canal was built in the 1770's for the transport of salt. Salt had been mined for 2000 years; by 1888 there were four saltworks in the town. In 1810 the Wardle branch of the Shropshire Union Canal was completed and joined to the Trent and Mersey. The canals are no longer used for transport : rather, for leisure pursuits in the form of boating holidays, trips, and coarse fishing. There are 2 boat sellers, Anderton and Willow Wrean Kearns opposite whose dry dock is a shop. Nearby is a milestone saying Shardlow 75 miles, Preston Brook 17 miles, and an inspector's office - Tommy Williams, the lock keeper. Andertons shop sells gas, maps, gifts and souvenirs.
